result.execSummary:
All charges against Diamond Lynn Diverse in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Diamond Lynn Diverse is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diamond Lynn Diverse

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CM262, 21CM521, 21CM612, 21CM617, 22CF133 & 22CF37 (STC):
CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Liddle. DA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared. Case called at 4:53 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. There is a resolution. DA Anderson recites agreement. No restitution are being requested. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE would like the former name of Brandon J. be removed. Court will look into and seal that name. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM521, NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 21CM612 and Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM617. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM521, NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 21CM612 and Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM617. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct.2 in 21CM521, Ct's 1, 3 & 4 in 21CM612, Ct's 1 & 3 in 21CM617. 21CM262, 22CF133 & 22CF37 are dismissed in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. DE's mother makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Court adjourned at 5:26 p.m. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1 in 21CM521:
- S/W 2 years Probation. Report to Probation by Friday 04/29/22 at 3 p.m. Call tomorrow. 
- Court costs of $243.00. Payable to DOC over the course of Probation. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
- AODA within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Psychological Assessment if requested by Agent
- Any other evaluation at Agent requests
- 60 days jail STAYED.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- No abusive contact with Kristi Jo D.
- Continue with current therapy
- Pay supervision fees

In Ct. 2 in 21CM612:

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

- No abusive contact with Kristi Jo D.
- Continue with current therapy
- Pay supervision fees

Pretrial Violation Report - JSC. SEALED. km       to rg

02:32 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. DA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared. Victim Witness present with Victim. Kara R. Dept of Health and Human Services appears. Includes 21CM262, 21CM521, 21CM612, 21CM617, and 22CF133. Court reviews case. Atty Selmer is not contesting evaluation. Court addresses DE. DE believes DE is competent. Court receives competency report. Court addresses Court official to hear all cases. Attys to address Court Officials. Off Record 02:40 PM. Back on Record 02:54 PM. Court addresses DE. Court addresses Victim. Court addresses bond request. Court sets STC.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 04:15 pm. Recall case 03:11 PM same appearances. DA Anderson bond requests. Court AMENDS bond in case 22CF133. Adjourned 03:14 PM
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

**AMENDED**

- Bond on file

- Defendant to test clean before released

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.Denver.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Competency hearing on April 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:31 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad appears via zoom, DF ATTY: Scott Selmer, DF: Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared from jail.  Court reviews case. ADA Smestad notes DE has not cooperated with Court ordered competency exam. Atty Selmer states there was a misunderstanding with the competency exam and those have been explained to DE. DE will cooperate with exam. Atty Selmer bond argument. Court DENIES bond modification. ADA Smestad raises competency concerns. Court makes findings and orders competency exam. Adjourned 08:42 AM  Competency hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:11 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: B. Berhow appeared by video means, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer, DF: Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared from jail. Court reviews file, notes competency issue raised at last hearing. Atty. Selmer states that DE agrees to complete competency evaluation, notes difficulty for DE with no contact condition in place. ADA Brekken objects to modification to no contact order. Court reviews Dr. Minter's report from pending case regarding DE's participation in completing evaluation. Court denies bond modification at this time. Court advises that DE needs to comply with evaluation. Atty. Selmer makes bond argument. Court agrees to make this bond consistent with other pending cases if the bonds are modified in the other cases. Court allows DE to send money to K. Denver's account. Bond continues. Court sets STC. Adjourned: 2:28 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Appointing Atty Selmer. km
Filed by DA's Office. km
Initial appearance on March 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

- Defendant to test clean before released

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K.Denver.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:18 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared. Court reviews case. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument. Sidebar. Court orders bond. Adjourned 01:26PM  Initial appearance scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
